result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian L Ledesma

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on May 16, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued

2:05 PM Defendant Brian L Ledesma in court with Attorney Anthony Delyea.  ADA Lexi Keyes in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Law Enforcement, Officer Marino, duly sworn & testified; Venue Established; Witness ID'd defn; No Cross. State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; Defense has no objection and Stipulates to jurisdiction being Dane County. Ct binds case over; bail continued
Preliminary hearing on October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
off the record Defendant in court requesting a set over. His attorney has not yet appeared. Court notes time limits have been waived and grants the request.

Defendant Brian L Ledesma in court, in custody.  Attorney Annie Jay in court for State of Wisconsin. Defn refused to apply for SPD. Defn advised he hired Atty Anthony Delyea. CT directs defn to have atty file NOR. CT sets for preliminary hearing. Time limits previously waived. Notice of hearing handed out in court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Time limits previously waived, will be applying for SPD.  Resetting in three week to give a little additional time.
Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not be at any bar, tavern, liquor store, or other premises whose primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 12

1:48 PM Prosecuting attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian L Ledesma in court, in custody.  Attorney Anthony C. Delyea in court for Brian L Ledesma. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
